business.headline: Sensex ends 213 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 213.45 points to close at 81,857.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.90 points to end at 25,050.55.

CA explains the risks behind 'No EMI till possession' schemesMany homebuyers are lured by "No EMI Till Possession" schemes, but a chartered accountant warns that these offers can carry hidden financial risks that may leave buyers paying for a property they never receive.

Indian-state run refiners resume Russian oil purchase amid tariff threats: ReportThe resumption of Russian oil imports by Indian state refiners could reduce supplies for top buyer China, which had stepped up purchases during their absence.

Labubu mania is back as Pop Mart shares rise by 11%, CEO predicts record salesPop Mart reported a 204% rise in revenue to 13.88 billion yuan for the first half of 2025, beating the average analyst estimate of 13.76 billion yuan. Net income jumped 397% to 4.57 billion yuan, highlighting the company's rapid growth.

Online gaming bill: Nazara Technologies and Delta Corp shares take a hitThe bill, which proposes strict rules for money-based online games and makes online betting a punishable offence, is expected to be tabled in the Lok Sabha later today.

Shifted to new tax regime? Here are 5 investments you shouldn't dropAlthough the new regime comes with lower tax rates and no exemptions, several traditional investment products continue to play a vital role in securing your finances and growing long-term wealth.

US targets Indian refiners, says richest families made excess profitsThe criticism from US is focused on India's private refiners, particularly Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, which together account for a large share of refined fuel exports to Europe.

Ola Electric shares jump 13%, up over 20% in two sessions. Should you buy?On Tuesday, the stock climbed almost sharply after founder and chairman Bhavish Aggarwal outlined an aggressive strategy to reclaim market share and improve profitability in India's competitive EV segment.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks offset IT gains in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 125.67 points to 81,518.72, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.50 points to 24,946.15 as of 9:33 am.

Game over for money-based online gaming? Industry in shock over proposed banIf passed in Parliament, the bill will outlaw all money-based online games (irrespective of whether they involve skill or chance), ban advertisements promoting such platforms, and bar banks and financial institutions from processing related transactions.

Death knell for industry: Gaming body writes to Amit Shah on money-based gaming banIn its communication, the All India Gaming Federation stressed the need for "progressive regulation" rather than outright prohibition, highlighting the potential fallout for millions of players and the broader industry.

Centre to ban all money-based gaming transactions under new bill: SourcesUnder the proposed Regulation & Promotion of Online Gaming Act, banks and financial institutions will not be allowed to process or transfer funds for real-money online games.

entertainment.headline: Host Ashneer Grover rejects 5 contestants on Rise & Fall for being boring: Source'Rise & Fall' host Ashneer Grover took charge of the show's casting and rejected five contestants, citing them boring. The show will premiere on MX Player.

After Coolie, Nagarjuna teams up with Tamil director Ra Karthik for 100th filmNagarjuna, who recently impressed audiences as Simon in Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', has now revealed details of his milestone 100th film, tentatively titled 'King 100'.

Hrithik Roshan mania rages on Mumbai streets as fans perform his hit tracks. WatchHrithik Roshan flocked to the Mumbai streets and performed on the actor's hit tracks amid the 'War 2' release. The video from the celebration has emerged online.

Rippan Swaamy trailer: Vijay Raghavendra's gritty rural drama promises thrillsThe trailer for Kannada actor Vijay Raghavendra's upcoming film 'Rippan Swaamy' was recently released. The film is set to release in theatres on August 29.

Gauahar Khan, Zaid Darbar host baby shower ahead of second child. WatchActor Gauahar Khan, expecting her second child with husband Zaid Darbar, hosted a beautiful baby shower that quickly went viral on social media.

Jr NTR's character in Prashanth Neel's Dragon gets Rs 15 crore house: ReportThe makers of Jr NTR's upcoming pan-India film 'Dragon' have reportedly built a specially designed house set exclusively for the actor's character at an estimated cost of Rs 15 crore.

Mohanlal leads as Mollywood rallies behind Mammootty ahead of his big returnMollywood is celebrating as Mammootty confirmed his full recovery after months of health concerns, expressing heartfelt gratitude to fans and well-wishers. The megastar's return has sparked joy across the industry, with Mohanlal and several celebrities joining in the tributes.

Stranger Things creators Duffer Brothers leave Netflix for 4-year Paramount dealProducers Matt Duffer and Ross Duffer are leaving Netflix to sign a four-year exclusive deal with Paramount. The deal between the 'Stranger Things' creators and Netflix comes to an end in April 2026.

Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's War 2 underperforms - trade experts explain whyHrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' has failed to meet box office expectations. Experts blame weak content, genre fatigue, and poor execution for the film's rejection.

The Map That Leads to You review: An addictive romance that feels like coming homeRelease Date:Wed Aug 20, 2025The Map That Leads to You movie review: 'The Map That Leads To You' is a heartfelt romance that captures the unpredictable, all-consuming nature of love through a journey across Europe. With stunning visuals and genuine chemistry between the leads, this film feels like a fresh, soul-stirring experience that resonates deeply with anyone who's ever fallen hard.

Amitabh Bachchan's Juhu bungalow Prateeksha flooded amid Mumbai's heavy rainsMumbai rains have wreaked havoc, with even celebrities facing the brunt. A viral video showed veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan's iconic Juhu home, Prateeksha, inundated with floodwater.

F1 The Movie OTT release: When and where to watch Brad Pitt's sports dramaHollywood actor Brad Pitt's 'F1: The Movie', directed by Joseph Kosinski and released in cinemas on June 27, is now set to arrive on streaming platforms. Find out when and where.

Vidhu Vinod Chopra recalls Vidya Balan giving him gaalis during Parineeta auditionsFilmmaker Vidhu Vinod Chopra shares how actor Vidya Balan secured her role in 'Parineeta'. He recalled that Balan was so tired by the final round of auditions that she must have given him gaalis.

Director Anil Sharma confirms Apne 2 script is ready, quashes shelf reports'Apne 2' director Anil Sharma confirmed that the scripting of the film is complete. This comes amid several reports about the project being shelved due to multiple delays,

Sooraj Barjatya backs Rupali Ganguly's call for National Awards for TV actorsTelevision actor Rupali Ganguly urged the government to recognise TV artistes at the National Awards, saying they work tirelessly without due acknowledgement. Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya supported her demand, calling television an art form that deserves equal respect as cinema.

Rapper Vedan's arrest stalled by Kerala High Court amid sexual assault allegationsThe Kerala High Court has put on hold the arrest of rapper Vedan pending police information on further cases. The court stressed that decisions must rely on evidence, not social media allegations, as it prepares to hear his anticipatory bail plea.

New Weasley siblings join Harry Potter series, Ginny played by Gracie CochraneThe makers of the new 'Harry Potter' series have announced the cast of the Weasley children. While Ginny is played by Gracie Cochrane, here are the other cast members.

Shruti Haasan on being called plastic surgery ki dukaan: This is my choiceShruti Haasan openly addressed the criticism she faces for her cosmetic procedures, highlighting the double standards women encounter regarding beauty and authenticity in the industry. Meanwhile, she celebrates the massive success of her latest film Coolie.

Priyanka Chopra in Nairobi for SSMB 29 shoot, enjoys safari outingActor Priyanka Chopra has joined Mahesh Babu in Nairobi for 'SSMB 29'. The film marks Chopra's return to Indian cinema, with a March 2027 release likely.

general news.headline: Opposition tears bills to remove arrested ministers, throws it at Amit Shah Live UpdatesUnder the proposed legislation, a Prime Minister, Chief Minister or minister facing charges with a minimum five-year jail term will lose their chair if they are arrested or detained for 30 consecutive days.

US targets Indian refiners, says richest families made excess profitsThe criticism from US is focused on India's private refiners, particularly Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, which together account for a large share of refined fuel exports to Europe.

Attacker pushed Rekha Gupta, pulled her hair: How 1-minute chaos unfoldedDelhi CM Rekha Gupta attack: India Today has pieced together the sequence of the events that happened at the Delhi Chief Minister's new Civil Lines residence shortly after 8 am.

Shree Ganesh karte hain: Russian diplomat mixes humour with oil assuranceRussian envoy Roman Babushkin said India's oil imports from Russia will remain stable, adding that President Vladimir Putin's New Delhi visit is planned for later this year.

Why govt's turning an exception into law has critics alarmedIn 75 years of Independent India's history, only one chief minister went to jail and ran a government from there. Now, the Centre is bringing in a law that seems to address this exception. The law could become Article 356 through the backdoor, and used to force CMs to toe the line or sack elected governments.

Ahmedabad Class 10 student stabbed to death by junior; anger, school vandalisedA 15-year-old student was fatally stabbed by a junior at an Ahmedabad school, triggering protests, vandalism, and police action.

Live: Bills to remove arrested PM, chief ministers sent to parliamentary panelParliament Session Live: Union Home Minister Amit Shah introduced three contentious bills in the Lok Sabha today which mandates ouster of a Union Minister, Chief Minister, or even the Prime Minister if they remain under arrest or detention for 30 consecutive days in cases carrying a minimum sentence of five years. The Oppostion parties strongly protested against the bills, calling it "destructive of the basic structure of the Constitution". Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw also tabled the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill. With the exception of brief discussions on Operation Sindoor in both Houses, parliamentary business has largely stalled since the Monsoon session opened on July 21, repeatedly disrupted by adjournments amid opposition protests. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

Is Russia giving India a 5% secret discount on oil amid Trump tariffs?Russia and India seem to have dug in their heels despite punitive tariffs and penalties from the Trump regime over energy trade. Russia might be giving a 5% discount on crude, which a top official termed "commerce secret", amid America's punitive 50% taxes on Indian exporters.

Swimmer's mural in Vasai becomes stunning optical illusion amid Mumbai floodsIn the photo, floodwater rises perfectly to the level of the swimmer's painted body, creating an illusion as if the swimmer is gliding through the water on the street.

Indian-origin Ketamine Queen linked to FRIENDS actor's death | 5 key pointsIndian-origin "Ketamine Queen" Jasveen Sangha, who once flaunted her LV and Chanel collections while on lavish foreign trips, has pleaded guilty in the drug overdose case linked to Friends actor Matthew Perry's death. Sangha, who operated a "drug-selling emporium" from her LA home, supplied ketamine to the actor days before his death. Sangha's story reveals the sinister world of LA's drugs underbelly.

If West criticises you...: Russia backs India amid US sanctions for oil importsRoman Babushkin, Charge d'Affaires of the Russian Embassy in India, said at a press briefing that India's strategic partnership with Moscow remains strong even amid pressures from the West.

Does Shubman Gill's return come at the cost of Sanju Samson's T20I career?Sanju Samson will likely become the sacrificial lamb as selectors bring back Shubman Gill into the T20I fold. With Gill rising as India's next all-format star, Samson's chances of establishing his legacy in T20 internationals look slimmer despite his explosive recent form.

Steamed, fried or tandoori, are momo truly healthy? Rujuta Diwekar answersFrom the mountains to street corners, momos have travelled across borders to become a soul snack for many. But beyond flavour, are they really healthy? Celebrity nutritionist Rujuta Diwekar has an opinion.

Why more Indian students are choosing Canada over the US in 2025Indian students are rethinking their global study destinations. With the US losing ground over rising costs and tougher visa rules, Canada is fast reclaiming its spot as the top choice.

Scientists 3D print metal atom by atom, customise its microstructureThis method enables scientists to customise not only the alloy's chemical makeup but also its microstructure, significantly enhancing metal strength and resilience.

Modi set for SCO Summit, how fragile border peace tests India-China thaw"Differences must not become disputes nor competition conflicts," external affairs minister S. Jaishankar has emphasised to his visiting Chinese counterpart Wang Yi

India's Stray Romance: Love, lies, rabies, solutionsIndia's romance with strays is a tragic farce - sacred cows choking, dogs biting - when proven fixes like sterilisation, shelters, and accountability could turn chaos into compassion. But our rage is just bark without bite.

China building megaconstellation to rival SpaceX's Starlink networkChina's initiative, sometimes called "Guowang" or "China's national network," seeks to emulate and compete with this success by launching its own megaconstellation.

Hyderabad hit by internet outage as officials cut cables after electrocution deathsAfter two major electrocution incidents during religious processions within 24 hours, Telangana's power body began cutting dangling internet and cable wires in Hyderabad. The sudden move caused mass outages, disrupting work-from-home, sparking outrage.

Indian-state run refiners resume Russian oil purchase amid tariff threats: ReportThe resumption of Russian oil imports by Indian state refiners could reduce supplies for top buyer China, which had stepped up purchases during their absence.

Why Shubman Gill for Asia Cup T20? With Virat Kohli gone, his idea enduresSanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma symbolise India's new brand of T20 audacity, yet selectors have turned to Shubman Gill for balance. His return, signals not just a tactical switch but also the renewal of an insurance policy that Virat Kohli once provided to the T20I side.

UP man's reaction goes viral after X user exposes his alleged Microsoft scam. WatchIn a post on X, NanoBaiter, who "tracks down and identifies scammers" according to his bio, claimed to have exposed Gaurav Trivedi who allegedly operates a classic "Microsoft support scam."

Who is Ashvir Singh Johal? The first Sikh and youngest manager in English footballAshvir Singh Johal has made history as the first Sikh to manage a professional British football club following his appointment at Morecambe. At 30, he also became the youngest manager across the top five tiers of English football.

sports.headline: Shreyas Iyer deserves T20 World Cup spot: Robin Uthappa after Asia Cup snubRobin Uthappa has backed Shreyas Iyer for a T20 World Cup 2026 return after his surprise exclusion from India's Asia Cup squad, calling the omission strange despite Iyer's IPL success and consistent domestic form.

What is IGPL? League that is set to swing a new era for Indian golfThe Indian Golf Premier League is set to change the landscape of the sport in the country. Amateurs and professionals will compete together, giving young talent a stage, bringing excitement to fans, and making the sport visible and inspiring in the country.

Vishwanathan Anand-Kasparov reunion, Gukesh vs Carlsen clash confirmedViswanathan Anand will renew his rivalry with Garry Kasparov in St Louis this October, while world champion D Gukesh takes on Magnus Carlsen in the Clutch Chess exhibition. With USD 412,000 at stake, it's set to be one of the year's biggest events.

ICC admits technical glitch after Kohli, Rohit vanish from ODI rankingsRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli disappeared from the ICC ODI rankings. The development comes only a week after they were placed at the 2nd and 4th spot. The disappearance is likely a glitch in the ICC system.

Sinquefield Cup: D Gukesh bounces back with superb win over AbdusattorovSinquefield Cup: D Gukesh bounced back from his opening-round setback with a fine win over former world rapid champion Nodirbek Abdusattorov of Uzbekistan in the second round. Meanwhile, R Praggnanandhaa drew quietly with Fabiano Caruana of the United States.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
